subject: Re: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
msgSnippet: Please help us help you by answering the questions. From your code it looks like your files are samples.HelloClass samples.TestHelloClass Are you running from
messageBody:
Please help us help you by answering the questions.

From your code it looks like your files are

samples.HelloClass
samples.TestHelloClass

Are you running from the command prompt ?
What is the command you issued ?
Where (which directory) are you running the command from ?
What is your classpath ?



>hi,
>
> When i am running TestHelloClass as junit.samples.TestHelloClass then
it
>is displaying the error as Class not found "junit.samples.TestHelloClass"
>
>Please give me the solution.
>
>thanks
>Anupama
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "Stevens, Timothy J. (LNG-ALB)" <timothy.j.stevens@...>
>To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2003 7:30 PM
>Subject: RE: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
>
>
>>
>> Are you running it via a command prompt? Are you running the test
>> from within the samples folder, or from the folder above? Which class
>cannot
>> be found?
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: anupama [mailto:anupama@...]
>> Sent: Tuesday, June 24, 2003 6:47 AM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: [junit] Class Not Found error--Urgent
>>
>>
>> hi,
>>
>> I am facing any problem while running the sample testcases,but while
>> running my own testcases i am getting a problem as Class Not Found.
>>
>> My source code is :
>> package samples;
>>
>> public class HelloClass
>> {
>> public String sayHello()
>> {
>> return"Hello World";
>> }
>> }
>>
>> My TestCase is:
>> package samples;
>>
>> import samples.*;
>> import junit.framework.*;
>>
>> public class TestHelloClass extends TestCase
>> {
>> public TestHelloClass(String s)
>> {
>> super(s);
>> }
>>
>> public void testSayHello()
>> {
>> HelloClass helloObject= newHelloClass();
>> assertEquals(helloObject.sayHello(),"HelloWorld");
>> }
>>
>> public static void main(String[] args)
>> {
>> junit.awtui.TestRunner.run(TestHelloClass.class);
>> }
>>
>> }
>>
>> I have placed both the files in the samples folder itself.
>> when i am running the above testcase i am facing class not found error.
>> can anyone give me the solution for this problem.Its urgent.
>>
>> Thanks
>> Anupama
>>
>>
>> Anupama Jangareddi
>> Jr.Software Engineer
